page.title: 09EARL STERNDALE CHURCHES
page.content: Earl Sterndale Parish Church was bombed in the second world war by enemy action on the 9th January 1941. They started to rebuild the Church on the 4th September 1950 and finished it on the 1st June 1952.The day after it was bombed there was a marriage in the ruins of the church.Miss Harrisson and Mr Wain were the couple who got married.While the Church was in ruins people had Sunday services in the school.This year the Radio Derby team came to record a service in the church called{"Wake Up And Sing".} There is a Methodist Chapel in the village,and there is a memorial stone on the wall.There is a Sunday School every Sunday morning for the children who want to go.It is held in the Chapel.Mrs Wain takes Sunday School and her fathers name is on the memorial stone that is on the wall.
